title: Accessing-Public-Reviews
Reviewing Drugs@FDA
text: going create living review FDA drug labels called Cardiotox@FDA. FDA Sysrev source created sysrev.com/p/111474/add-articles selecting FDA docs application type new drug application NDA document type Review text matching cardiotoxicity. Learn FDA applications types FDA Drugs Developed. Creating Drugs@FDA source search results 112 articles, manageable size vignette. Import pushes labels Cardiotox@FDA sysrev. can inspect data source, add notes, set automatically add new articles match query clicking “check new results” cardiotox@fda sources page (screenshot). Clicking check new results makes living review Anytime FDA adds new drug application review document “cardiotoxicity” text added review. might useful?

title: Reviewing Drugs@FDA
text: importing source can start analyzing documents. rsr::get_article_content(111474) retrieves article content (including meta-data) every imported FDA drug document. code associates sysrev article_id (called aid) druglabel review type, sponsor, products data, submission data. Sometimes document contains multiple submissions products. complex subfields can many rows columns. code, extract active ingredient product, review priority / submission type submission. Joining meta, products submission tables sysrev article_id (aid) gives us basic analyis table fda.tb. Note article ids repeated documents multiple products/submissions.
code: meta.tb = rsr::get_article_content(111474)               |> # sysrev article content   mutate(path     = glue('{here()}/tmp/pdf/{aid}.pdf'))  |> # make local file names   mutate(metadata = map(metadata,jsonlite::parse_json))  |> # map FDA metadata to list   unnest_wider(metadata)                                 |> # map FDA list to columns   select(aid,                                       fda.id     = ApplNo,             # FDA Application Number          sponsor    = SponsorName,        # Sponsor of reviewed product           review     = ReviewDocumentType, # review type medical, pharmacology,etc.          product    = Products,           # nested list containing product data          submission = Submissions,        # nested list with submission data          url        = contentUrl,         # a url for the included pdf          path)                            # a local path where we store the pdfs  meta.tb[1:2,] ## # A tibble: 2 × 8 ##        aid fda.id sponsor             review   product submission url     path   ##      <int> <chr>  <chr>               <chr>    <list>  <list>     <chr>   <glue> ## 1 13913155 207561 GILEAD SCIENCES INC medical… <list … <list [18… https:… /home… ## 2 13913084 209360 LA JOLLA PHARMA     risk as… <list … <list [1]> https:… /home… prod.tb = meta.tb |> select(aid,product)            |> # build aid -> products tbl   unnest_longer(product) |> unnest_wider(product)   |> # list to columns   separate_rows(ActiveIngredient,sep="; ")          |> # "name; name" -> 2 rows   select(aid, prod.active = ActiveIngredient)  sub.tb = meta.tb |> select(aid,submission)               |> # build aid -> submission   unnest_longer(submission) |> unnest_wider(submission)  |> # list to columns   select(aid,          sub.priority = ReviewPriority,          sub.subtype  = SubmissionType) fda.tb = meta.tb |> left_join(prod.tb,by="aid") |> left_join(sub.tb, by="aid") |>   select(aid, sponsor, review, sub.priority, sub.subtype, prod.active) |>   distinct()  fda.tb[1:2,] ## # A tibble: 2 × 6 ##        aid sponsor             review       sub.priority sub.subtype prod.active ##      <int> <chr>               <chr>        <chr>        <chr>       <chr>       ## 1 13913155 GILEAD SCIENCES INC medical rev… STANDARD     ORIG        COBICISTAT  ## 2 13913155 GILEAD SCIENCES INC medical rev… STANDARD     SUPPL       COBICISTAT

title: Reviewing Drugs@FDA
text: inspectDF provides quick way analyze fda.tb.  table shows gilead sciences imported documents ( x products x submissions ). Thre quite active ingredients, top 5 distinct(aid) : COBICISTAT, SOFOSBUVIR, ELVITEGRAVIR, EMTRICITABINE, NALOXONE HYDROCHLORIDE many Gilead active ingredients?
code: icat <- inspectdf::inspect_cat(fda.tb) icat |> inspectdf::show_plot(label_color = "black") fda.tb |> filter(sponsor=="GILEAD SCIENCES INC")        |> # GET GSI docs   count(prod.active,priority=sub.priority=="PRIORITY")    |> # get count by priority   ggplot(aes(x=reorder(prod.active,n),y=n,fill=priority)) +  # make a plot   geom_col(position = "stack") # + ...

title: Reviewing Drugs@FDA
text: Sadly, information FDA docs metadata. can learned reading, extracting data docs. identify sentences contain information like:1. phenotypes: cardiotoxicity referenced? phenotypes ?2. dose:
code: rsr::get_answers(111474) |>    select(aid,user_id,confirm_time,short_label,value_type,answer) ## # A tibble: 2 × 6 ##        aid user_id confirm_time        short_label        value_type answer      ##      <int>   <int> <chr>               <chr>              <chr>      <chr>       ## 1 13913147     139 2022-01-16 19:44:29 cardiotox sentence annotation "{\"34afa2… ## 2 13913147     139 2022-01-16 19:44:29 Include            boolean    "true"

title: Reviewing Drugs@FDA
text: Sysrev services provide functions can automate document review tasks like data sourcing, extraction, review analysis. two services avaiable project: Services still development, EN_TOX tool, developed Marc Teunis Marie Corradi EU ONTOX project can automate manual labelling tasks described . service takes text returns named toxicological entities.
code: rsr::service_list(111474) ## # A tibble: 2 × 4 ##   service        status description             reference                        ##   <chr>          <chr>  <chr>                   <chr>                            ## 1 en_tox         active NER for toxicology      https://github.com/ontox-hu/...  ## 2 export_answers active export answers to excel https://github.com/sysrev/servi… possible_text = pdftools::pdf_text |> possibly(other = NA_character_) en_tox        = partial(service_run,pid=111474,service="en_tox") |>  possibly(o = tibble())  entity.fda = meta.tb |> select(aid,path) |> slice(1:5)            |>    mutate(text     = pblapply(path,possible_text)) |> unnest(text) |>    mutate(text     = gsub(pat =" +",repl = " ", trimws(text)))     |>    mutate(entities = pblapply(text,en_tox))                        |>    unnest(entities) |>    select(aid,entity,value,context)  # Run on all files -> "entity.fda.RDS" entity.fda = readRDS("data/entity.fda.RDS")  entity.count = entity.fda |>    mutate(entity=as.factor(entity),value=as.factor(tolower(value))) |>    select(aid,entity,value) |> distinct() |>    group_by(entity) |> mutate(value = forcats::fct_lump_n(value,10)) |> ungroup() |>    group_by(entity,value) |> summarize(docs = n_distinct(aid)) ## `summarise()` has grouped output by 'entity'. You can override using the `.groups` argument. ggplot(entity.count,aes(x=reorder(value,docs),y=docs)) + geom_col() + coord_flip() +    facet_wrap(~entity,scales = "free_y",ncol = 2) +   scale_y_continuous(expand=c(0,0)) + ggtitle("EN_TOX top FDA drug label extracted entities") +   ggthemes::theme_fivethirtyeight()

title: rsr
text: Install Authenticate Get sysrev token sysrev.com user page. Pubmed example Setup simple review pubmed title/abstracts.
code: devtools::install_github('sysrev/rsr') library(rsr)  # Create/get a sysrev project sr = create_sysrev("rsr",get_if_exists=T)  # Import articles from pubmed with pmids create_source_pmids(sr,pmids=c(1000,10001))  # pull article data into R get_articles(sr) #      aid title                                       #    <int> <chr>                                       # 13747809 The amino acid sequence… # 13747810 Study of the biological… # # project_id <int>, title <chr> …  browse_sysrev(sr) # Open sysrev in browser
